description.narrative: The project aims at increasing the autonomy of women in the rural communities in Macaya through strengthening their economic opportunities and participation in decision-making. This kind of empowerment requires building women?s basic capacities such as lit eracy, organisational and leadership skills as well as their awareness on human rights, particularly women?s rights and sexual and reproductive rights. Simultaneously, their economic and livelihoods skills are strengthened, in order to both increase their revenues and strengthen the valorisation of their work and role in the communities. 1. Women have the capacity to effectively participate in decision making ? Functional literacy and consciousness-raising ? Strengthening the social dynamics and female lead ership (community development, networking, cohesion, identifying new initiatives) ? Advocacy on women?s rights ? Awareness-raising in reproductive health, Human Rights, Gender and citizenship 2. Women?s entrepreneurial initiatives contribute to their full empowerment? Development of entrepreneurial initiatives ? Skills training ? Support and capacity building to women's groups engaged in entrepreneurial activities ? Training and awareness-raising on environmental protection and rational use of natural resou rces? Training of project staff Rights-holders /beneficiaries: The female population in the intervention area is roughly 1 800. Most of the women in the project area have no basic education and are illiterate. Their vulnerability and poverty is linked to n ot having access to resources and basic services (education, health, food, justice etc.). They undertake small trade activities (selling matches, sweets, etc.), and production and sales of agricultural products (garden produce and spices). Implementing par tner: Lutheran World Federation/Department of World Service (LWF/DWS) Haiti.
